snippet: Ned Benson spent nearly a decade working on “The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby,” and ended up making not one film but three, with the same cast.
abstract: Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby screenwriter and director Ned Benson discusses how he ended up making not one film, but three, using same cast to tell story from different point of view; Benson says it was not his original intention, but decided during decade spent on material that it was best way to tell story.
lead_paragraph: Ned Benson spent nearly a decade working on “The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby,” and ended up making not one film but three, with the same cast.

headline.seo: 'The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby' Stars Jessica Chastain
